name: Jung Koo Kang
title: Faculty
bio: Jung Koo Kang is an Assistant Professor of Business Administration in the Accounting and Management Unit at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on financial technology and innovation, alternative data, debt contracting, and financial intermediation, examining how emerging technologies reshape credit markets.

name: Susanna Gallani*
title: Faculty
bio: Susanna Gallani is the Tai Family Associate Professor of Business Administration in the Accounting and Management unit. At HBS, she co-teaches the MBA elective curriculum course Transforming Health Care Delivery.

name: Robert Simons
title: Faculty
bio: Robert Simons is the Baker Foundation Professor at Harvard Business School, where he has taught strategy execution and management control systems for over 30 years. He is the author of 'Levers of Control,' which won the Notable Contribution to Management Accounting Literature Award and established a framework for balancing innovation and control in organizations.

name: Susanna Gallani
title: Faculty
bio: Susanna Gallani is the Tai Family Associate Professor of Business Administration in the Accounting and Management unit. At HBS, she co-teaches the MBA elective curriculum course Transforming Health Care Delivery.

name: Suraj Srinivasan
title: Faculty
bio: Suraj Srinivasan is the Philip J. Stomberg Professor of Business Administration and chair of the Digital Value Lab at Harvard's Digital, Data, and Design Institute. His research examines corporate disclosure practices, securities regulation, audit firm incentives, and the reputational consequences of financial reporting problems.

name: Suraj Srinivasan
title: Faculty
bio: Suraj Srinivasan is the Philip J. Stomberg Professor of Business Administration and chair of the Digital Value Lab at Harvard's Digital, Data, and Design Institute. His research examines corporate disclosure practices, securities regulation, audit firm incentives, and the reputational consequences of financial reporting problems.

name: Jonas Heese
title: Faculty
bio: Jonas Heese is a Professor of Business Administration in the Accounting and Management Unit at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on corporate misconduct and the role of regulators, whistleblowers, the media, and compliance systems in preventing such misconduct.

name: Robert L. Simons
title: Faculty
bio: Robert L. Simons is the Baker Foundation Professor at Harvard Business School, where he has taught strategy execution and management control systems for over 30 years. He is the author of 'Levers of Control,' which won the Notable Contribution to Management Accounting Literature Award and established a framework for balancing innovation and control in organizations.

name: Jeremy Friedman
title: Faculty
bio: Jeremy Friedman is an Assistant Professor in the Business, Government, and International Economy Unit at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on the history of communism, socialism, and revolution, and he is the author of 'Shadow Cold War' and 'Ripe for Revolution: Building Socialism in the Third World.'

name: Awa Ambra Seck
title: Faculty
bio: Awa Ambra Seck is an Assistant Professor in the Business, Government, and International Economy Unit at Harvard Business School. Her research explores the enduring effects of colonial policies and how cultural traits shape policy effectiveness, examining how historical legacies influence migration networks, economic development, and political mobilization in Africa.

name: Marco Tabellini
title: Faculty
bio: Marco Tabellini is an Assistant Professor in the Business, Government, and International Economy Unit at Harvard Business School. His research explores how international and internal migration reshapes politics, societies, and the economy, examining when immigration stirs political backlash and what drives successful social integration.

name: Caroline M. Elkins
title: Faculty
bio: Caroline Elkins is the Thomas Henry Carroll/Ford Foundation Professor of Business Administration and founding director of Harvard's Center for African Studies. Her book 'Imperial Reckoning: The Untold Story of Britain's Gulag in Kenya' was awarded the Pulitzer Prize for General Nonfiction.

name: Debora L. Spar
title: Faculty
bio: Debora Spar is the Jaime and Josefina Chua Tiampo Professor of Business Administration and Senior Associate Dean for Business and Global Society at Harvard Business School. She previously served as President of Barnard College and President of Lincoln Center, and her research focuses on gender, technology, and social change.

name: Natalia Garbiras-Díaz
title: Faculty
bio: Natalia Garbiras-Díaz is an Assistant Professor in the Business, Government, and International Economy Unit at Harvard Business School. Her research focuses on corruption, public goods provision, and accountability in Latin America, and her work on citizen oversight and electoral integrity was published in the American Economic Review.

name: Vincent Pons
title: Faculty
bio: Vincent Pons is a Professor at Harvard Business School whose research examines the foundations of democracy, including voter participation, preference formation, and the effects of elections on policy. He received the 2023 Best Young French Economist Award and has published in top journals including Econometrica and the American Economic Review.

name: Jesse M. Shapiro
title: Faculty
bio: Jesse Shapiro is the George Gund Professor of Economics and Business Administration at Harvard Business School. A 2021 MacArthur Fellow, his research on media bias, ideological polarization, and behavioral economics has been widely recognized, with The Economist naming him one of the 8 best young economists in the world.

name: Ebehi Iyoha
title: Faculty
bio: Ebehi Iyoha is an Assistant Professor in the Entrepreneurial Management Unit at Harvard Business School. Her research sits at the intersection of industrial organization and international trade, examining how inter-firm networks shape productivity, innovation, and trade in both advanced and emerging economies.

name: Jaya Y. Wen
title: Faculty
bio: Jaya Wen is an Assistant Professor in the Business, Government, and International Economy Unit at Harvard Business School. Her research focuses on how autocracies use economic policy to manage threats and how firms adapt to those pressures, with a particular focus on China and state-owned enterprises.

name: Jaya Y. Wen
title: Faculty
bio: Jaya Wen is an Assistant Professor in the Business, Government, and International Economy Unit at Harvard Business School. Her research focuses on how autocracies use economic policy to manage threats and how firms adapt to those pressures, with a particular focus on China and state-owned enterprises.

name: Ebehi Iyoha
title: Faculty
bio: Ebehi Iyoha is an Assistant Professor in the Entrepreneurial Management Unit at Harvard Business School. Her research sits at the intersection of industrial organization and international trade, examining how inter-firm networks shape productivity, innovation, and trade in both advanced and emerging economies.

name: J. Gunnar Trumbull
title: Faculty
bio: Gunnar Trumbull is the Phillip Caldwell Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His expertise is in political economy with a focus on climate change, and he authored 'A Concise Business Guide to Climate Change' and the award-winning 'Strength in Numbers: The Political Power of Weak Interests.'

name: Benjamin N. Roth
title: Faculty
bio: Benjamin Roth is the Purnima Puri and Richard Barrera Associate Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. He is a development economist who uses economic theory and field experimentation to study constraints on small-scale entrepreneurship in the developing world and impact investing.

name: Christopher Stanton
title: Faculty
bio: Christopher Stanton is the Marvin Bower Associate Professor of Business Administration in the Entrepreneurial Management Unit at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on labor markets, technology's impact on the workforce, and the gig economy, and he teaches the MBA elective 'Managing the Future of Work.'

name: Rembrand Koning
title: Faculty
bio: Rembrand Koning is the Mary V. and Mark A. Stevens Associate Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research explores biases and frictions that shape how founders and markets learn, with current work examining how AI is transforming entrepreneurship globally.

name: Juan Alcacer
title: Faculty
bio: Juan Alcacer is the James J. Hill Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on international strategies in the telecommunications industry and how competition affects location decisions of multinationals, and he received the Greenhill Award for Outstanding Service for his work on Field Global Immersion.

name: Paul A. Gompers
title: Faculty
bio: Paul Gompers is the Eugene Holman Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School, specializing in venture capital, private equity, and entrepreneurial finance. He has co-authored three books on the venture capital industry and served as director of research at HBS for nine years.

name: N. Louis Shipley
title: Faculty
bio: Lou Shipley is a Senior Lecturer in the Entrepreneurial Management Unit at Harvard Business School and a three-time technology CEO, most recently at Black Duck Software. He teaches courses on entrepreneurial sales and go-to-market strategies, and specializes in tech entrepreneurship and building effective leadership teams for startups.

name: Tom Nicholas
title: Faculty
bio: Tom Nicholas is the William J. Abernathy Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on the history of entrepreneurship, innovation, and finance, and he is the author of 'VC: An American History' which examines the historical roots of the U.S. venture capital industry.

name: Richard S. Tedlow
title: Faculty
bio: Richard Tedlow is the Class of 1949 Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School, specializing in business history. He authored 'Giants of Enterprise: Seven Business Innovators and the Empires They Built,' selected as one of Business Week's top 10 business books of 2001, and 'The Watson Dynasty' about IBM's founders.

name: Paul A. Gompers
title: Faculty
bio: Paul Gompers is the Eugene Holman Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School, specializing in venture capital, private equity, and entrepreneurial finance. He has co-authored three books on the venture capital industry and served as director of research at HBS for nine years.

name: Philippe van der Beck
title: Faculty
bio: Philippe van der Beck is an Assistant Professor in the Finance Unit at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on empirical asset pricing, sustainable finance, and ESG investing, and his work on ESG flows and asset prices won the Swiss Finance Institute Best Paper Doctoral Award 2022.

name: William Vrattos
title: Faculty
bio: William Vrattos is a Senior Lecturer at Harvard Business School and Managing Partner and Chief Investment Officer of York Capital Management, a global alternative asset manager. He teaches Investment Strategies and co-teaches Private Equity Projects and Ecosystems in the MBA elective curriculum.

name: Malcolm Baker
title: Faculty
bio: Malcolm Baker is the Robert G. Kirby Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on behavioral finance, corporate finance, and capital markets, particularly the interactions among corporate finance, investor behavior, and market inefficiency. He is also a former Olympic rower.

name: David Scharfstein
title: Faculty
bio: David Scharfstein is the Edmund Cogswell Converse Professor of Finance and Banking at Harvard Business School. His research covers financial intermediation, regulation, and corporate finance, and he served as senior advisor to the U.S. Treasury Secretary in 2009-2010.

name: Emil Nuwan Siriwardane
title: Faculty
bio: Emil Siriwardane is the Finnegan Family Associate Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research studies financial intermediation and arbitrage, with notable work showing that just five sellers account for nearly half the U.S. credit default swap market.

name: Mark Egan
title: Faculty
bio: Mark Egan is a Professor in the Finance Unit at Harvard Business School whose research focuses on financial adviser misconduct. His analysis found that approximately one in 15 financial advisers has a misconduct record, and his work on 'naming and shaming' was published in the Journal of Economic Perspectives.

name: Luis M. Viceira
title: Faculty
bio: Luis Viceira is the George E. Bates Professor at Harvard Business School and a leading expert on asset allocation strategies for long-term investors. His research has won multiple awards including the TIAA-CREF Paul Samuelson Award and the Graham and Dodd Award from the CFA Institute.

name: John D. Macomber
title: Faculty
bio: John Macomber is a Senior Lecturer in the Finance Unit and Faculty Chair of the HBS Africa Research Center at Harvard Business School. His work focuses on climate adaptation and infrastructure finance, particularly public-private partnerships for delivering resilient infrastructure in developing and emerging markets.

name: Richard S. Ruback
title: Faculty
bio: Richard Ruback is the Willard Prescott Smith Professor of Corporate Finance at Harvard Business School. He co-teaches courses on acquiring small businesses and co-authored 'HBR Guide to Buying a Small Business,' helping establish the field of entrepreneurship through acquisition.

name: John D. Macomber
title: Faculty
bio: John Macomber is a Senior Lecturer in the Finance Unit and Faculty Chair of the HBS Africa Research Center at Harvard Business School. His work focuses on climate adaptation and infrastructure finance, particularly public-private partnerships for delivering resilient infrastructure in developing and emerging markets.

name: Benjamin C. Esty
title: Faculty
bio: Benjamin Esty is the Roy and Elizabeth Simmons Professor of Business Administration and Head of the Finance Unit at Harvard Business School. He is a leading expert on project finance and infrastructure investment, and authored 'Modern Project Finance: A Casebook.'

name: Richard S. Ruback
title: Faculty
bio: Richard Ruback is the Willard Prescott Smith Professor of Corporate Finance at Harvard Business School. He co-teaches courses on acquiring small businesses and co-authored 'HBR Guide to Buying a Small Business,' helping establish the field of entrepreneurship through acquisition.

name: Royce Yudkoff
title: Faculty
bio: Royce Yudkoff is the MBA Class of 1975 Professor of Management Practice at Harvard Business School and co-founder of ABRY Partners. He co-teaches courses on small business acquisition and co-authored 'HBR Guide to Buying a Small Business' with Richard Ruback.

name: Shunyuan Zhang,
title: Faculty
bio: Shunyuan Zhang is an Associate Professor in the Marketing Unit at Harvard Business School. Her research focuses on the sharing economy and platforms like Airbnb, using machine learning and deep learning methods to analyze unstructured data and understand emerging marketing challenges.

name: Julian De Freitas,
title: Faculty
bio: Julian De Freitas is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School and Director of the Ethical Intelligence Lab. His research examines how AI impacts marketing, branding, and customer relationships, and he was a Rhodes Scholar.

name: Jeremy Yang,
title: Faculty
bio: Jeremy Yang is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School whose research focuses on the digital economy, large language models, and the creator economy. He developed algorithms analyzing 40,000 TikTok influencer ads to predict product sales impact.

name: Das Narayandas
title: Faculty
bio: Das Narayandas is the Edsel Bryant Ford Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research and teaching focus on marketing, sales, and leadership, and he has served as Senior Associate Dean for Harvard Business Publishing and Executive Education.

name: Sunil Gupta,
title: Faculty
bio: Sunil Gupta is the Edward W. Carter Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on digital technology's impact on consumer behavior and firm strategy, and his book 'Driving Digital Strategy' guides businesses through digital transformation.

name: Isamar Troncoso
title: Faculty
bio: Isamar Troncoso is an Assistant Professor in the Marketing Unit at Harvard Business School. Her research explores digital marketplaces and AI applications in marketing, combining econometrics, causal inference, and machine learning to study platform design and consumer behavior.

name: Anita Elberse
title: Faculty
bio: Anita Elberse is the Lincoln Filene Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. One of the youngest women to earn tenure at HBS, she specializes in entertainment, media, and sports industries, and authored 'Blockbusters: Hit-making, Risk-taking, and the Big Business of Entertainment.'

name: Ayelet Israeli
title: Faculty
bio: Ayelet Israeli is the Marvin Bower Associate Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School and co-founder of the Customer Intelligence Lab. Her research focuses on omnichannel and e-commerce markets, with an emphasis on how businesses can leverage data to improve marketing outcomes.

name: Leonard A. Schlesinger
title: Faculty
bio: Leonard Schlesinger is the Baker Foundation Professor at Harvard Business School and co-author of 'The Service Profit Chain,' one of the most researched management concepts of the last 30 years. He previously served as President of Babson College and Vice Chairman and COO of Limited Brands.

name: Elie Ofek
title: Faculty
bio: Elie Ofek is the Malcolm P. McNair Professor of Marketing at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on new product strategies in technology-driven environments, particularly the integration of R&D and marketing decisions, and he teaches courses on pricing strategy and innovation.

name: Rajiv Lal
title: Faculty
bio: Rajiv Lal is the Stanley Roth, Sr. Professor of Retailing at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on retail strategy, omnichannel retailing, and the future of brick-and-mortar stores, and he has served as course head for the MBA Marketing curriculum.

name: Iavor I Bojinov
title: Faculty
bio: Iavor Bojinov is an Associate Professor at Harvard Business School and co-creator of the MBA course 'Data Science for Managers.' His research focuses on causal inference and experimental design, helping firms innovate through more rigorous business experimentation and AI operationalization.

name: Raffaella Sadun
title: Faculty
bio: Raffaella Sadun is the Charles E. Wilson Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. Her research on management practices and productivity co-founded the World Management Survey, and she won the HBR McKinsey Award for 'Why do we undervalue competent management?'

name: Shunyuan Zhang
title: Faculty
bio: Shunyuan Zhang is an Associate Professor in the Marketing Unit at Harvard Business School. Her research focuses on the sharing economy and platforms like Airbnb, using machine learning and deep learning methods to analyze unstructured data and understand emerging marketing challenges.

name: Maren Hoff
title: Faculty
bio: Maren Hoff is a Professor in the Marketing unit at Harvard Business School. They research consumer behavior, brand strategy, and market dynamics.

name: Julian De Freitas
title: Faculty
bio: Julian De Freitas is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School and Director of the Ethical Intelligence Lab. His research examines how AI impacts marketing, branding, and customer relationships, and he has published over 40 articles in journals including Nature Human Behavior and the Journal of Consumer Research.

name: Eva Ascarza
title: Faculty
bio: Eva Ascarza is the Jakurski Family Associate Professor at Harvard Business School and co-founder of the Customer Intelligence Lab. Her research on customer retention challenges the common practice of focusing on 'risk of churning,' showing that high-risk customers are not always the best targets for retention programs.

name: Irene Georgescu
title: Faculty
bio: Irene Georgescu is a Professor in the Marketing unit at Harvard Business School. They research consumer behavior, brand strategy, and market dynamics.

name: Sunil Gupta
title: Faculty
bio: Sunil Gupta is the Edward W. Carter Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on digital technology's impact on consumer behavior and firm strategy, and his book 'Driving Digital Strategy' guides businesses through digital transformation.

name: Alex Chan
title: Faculty
bio: Alex Chan is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School who studies how market failures occur and how to design incentives and engineer markets to remedy them. A former McKinsey consultant and Optum executive, he has worked with healthcare organizations to launch actual marketplaces including a liver exchange in Pakistan.

name: Amit Goldenberg
title: Faculty
bio: Amit Goldenberg is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School whose research examines emotions in social and group contexts, particularly how technology like large language models can both elicit and help manage emotions. He holds a PhD in Psychology from Stanford University.

name: Livia Alfonsi
title: Faculty
bio: Livia Alfonsi is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School whose research focuses on labor market frictions in low-income settings, particularly barriers to youth employment and female labor market participation. Her 'Meet Your Future' mentorship program improved employment outcomes by 27%.

name: Edward H. Chang
title: Faculty
bio: Edward Chang is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School whose research focuses on improving diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace through large-scale field experiments. His work has examined whether diversity training changes behavior and how diversity goals in job ads affect applications.

name: Joshua Schwartzstein
title: Faculty
bio: Joshua Schwartzstein is the Cahners-Rabb Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. A behavioral economist, he incorporates psychologically realistic assumptions about attention, memory, and perception into economic frameworks, and won the 2025 Arrow Award for his research on clinical trials.

name: Jillian J. Jordan
title: Faculty
bio: Jillian Jordan is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School whose research investigates moral behavior and the psychology that surrounds it, particularly moral signaling and reputation management. Her work has been published in Nature, PNAS, and Harvard Business Review.

name: Julian J. Zlatev
title: Faculty
bio: Julian Zlatev is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School and Co-Chair of the Organizational Behavior doctoral program. His research focuses on ethics and morality, trust, impression formation, and prosocial behavior, and he teaches the second-year Negotiation course.

name: Ashley Whillans
title: Faculty
bio: Ashley Whillans is the Volpert Family Associate Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. Her research focuses on time-money trade-offs and their impact on well-being, and her book 'Time Smart: How to Reclaim Your Time & Live a Happier Life' won a distinguished dissertation award.

name: Julian Zlatev
title: Faculty
bio: Julian Zlatev is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School and Co-Chair of the Organizational Behavior doctoral program. His research focuses on ethics and morality, trust, impression formation, and prosocial behavior, and he teaches the second-year Negotiation course.

name: Michael I. Norton
title: Faculty
bio: Michael Norton is the Harold M. Brierley Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research on behavioral economics and well-being led to the bestselling book 'Happy Money: The Science of Happier Spending,' and his TEDx talk on buying happiness has over 4.5 million views.

name: Linda A. Hill
title: Faculty
bio: Linda Hill is the Wallace Brett Donham Professor of Business Administration and Faculty Chair of the Leadership Initiative at Harvard Business School. She is co-author of 'Collective Genius: The Art and Practice of Leading Innovation' and her TED talk on managing for creativity has over 2.6 million views.

name: Boris Groysberg
title: Faculty
bio: Boris Groysberg is the Richard P. Chapman Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on talent management and how firms can achieve sustainable competitive advantage through human capital, and he authored 'Chasing Stars: The Myth of Talent and the Portability of Performance.'

name: Ranjay Gulati
title: Faculty
bio: Ranjay Gulati is the Paul R. Lawrence MBA Class of 1942 Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on leadership and strategic challenges for high-growth organizations, and his book 'Deep Purpose' explores how companies achieve high performance through authentic purpose.

name: James Riley
title: Faculty
bio: James Riley is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School and Principal Investigator of the blackbox Lab at the D³ Institute. An economic sociologist, his research focuses on digital transformations and their role in addressing historic inequities related to race, culture, technology, and business.

name: David G. Fubini
title: Faculty
bio: David Fubini is a Senior Lecturer at Harvard Business School and former Senior Director of McKinsey & Company. He specializes in mergers and acquisitions, having led integration efforts for nearly a dozen of the 25 largest global transactions since 2010, and authored 'Hidden Truths: What Leaders Need to Hear But Are Rarely Told.'

name: Rakesh Khurana
title: Faculty
bio: Rakesh Khurana is the Marvin Bower Professor of Leadership Development at Harvard Business School and the Danoff Dean of Harvard College. His research focuses on how elites and leaders are selected and developed, and he authored 'Searching for a Corporate Savior: The Irrational Quest for Charismatic CEOs.'

name: Ryan Raffaelli
title: Faculty
bio: Ryan Buell is the C.D. Spangler Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research investigates how operational transparency and service design affect customer behavior and firm performance, and he has received multiple awards for teaching excellence.

name: Jon M. Jachimowicz
title: Faculty
bio: Jon Jachimowicz is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School who studies the experience and consequences of passion at work. His research reveals that passion is developed rather than found and can lead to emotional fatigue and burnout, based on interviews with 200 high achievers including Fortune 500 CEOs.

name: Lakshmi Ramarajan
title: Faculty
bio: Lakshmi Ramarajan is the Anna Spangler Nelson and Thomas C. Nelson Associate Professor at Harvard Business School. Her research examines how people manage their professional identity alongside other identities traditionally considered outside work, such as family roles, values, race, class, and gender.

name: David G. Fubini
title: Faculty
bio: David Fubini is a Senior Lecturer at Harvard Business School and former Senior Director of McKinsey & Company. He specializes in mergers and acquisitions, having led integration efforts for nearly a dozen of the 25 largest global transactions since 2010, and authored 'Hidden Truths: What Leaders Need to Hear But Are Rarely Told.'

name: Alexandra C. Feldberg
title: Faculty
bio: Alexandra Feldberg is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School whose research examines intersections between gender, knowledge-transfer, technology, and discrimination within firms. Her work has been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Harvard Business Review.

name: Anthony J. Mayo
title: Faculty
bio: Anthony Mayo is the Thomas S. Murphy Senior Lecturer at Harvard Business School and former director of the Leadership Initiative. He co-authored 'In Their Time: The Greatest Business Leaders of the 20th Century' and is co-editor of 'Race, Work, and Leadership: New Perspectives on the Black Experience.'

name: Lumumba Seegars
title: Faculty
bio: Lumumba Seegars is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School whose research explores how intergroup inequality is reproduced and contested within organizations, focusing on racial, gender, and class inequality. Prior to graduate school, he worked as a teacher, actor, campaign organizer, and minister.

name: Jorge Tamayo
title: Faculty
bio: Jorge Tamayo is an Assistant Professor in the Strategy Unit at Harvard Business School. His research examines multiunit firms and explains why units operating under the same brand and systems display large differences in productivity, focusing on internal coordination costs rather than external market conditions.

name: Ramon Casadesus-Masanell
title: Faculty
bio: Ramon Casadesus-Masanell is the Herman C. Krannert Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. He studies strategic interaction between organizations with different business models and co-edits the Journal of Economics and Management Strategy.

name: Juan Alcácer
title: Faculty
bio: Juan Alcácer is the James J. Hill Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research focuses on international strategies in the telecommunications industry and how competition affects location decisions of multinationals, and he received the Greenhill Award for Outstanding Service.

name: Rebecca Karp
title: Faculty
bio: Rebecca Karp is an Assistant Professor in the Strategy Unit at Harvard Business School. A field researcher and ethnographer, she studies how companies formulate and execute strategies, particularly how innovation supports strategy execution, and won the 2020 William H. Newman Award from the Academy of Management.

name: Andy Wu
title: Faculty
bio: Andy Wu is the Arjun and Minoo Melwani Family Associate Professor at Harvard Business School. His research examines how technology entrepreneurs organize resources and adapt to cutting-edge technologies like generative AI and digital platforms, and he has received the HBS Wyss Award and Poets & Quants 40 Under 40 recognition.

name: Raffaella Sadun
title: Faculty
bio: Raffaella Sadun is the Charles E. Wilson Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. Her research on management practices and productivity co-founded the World Management Survey, and she won the HBR McKinsey Award for 'Why do we undervalue competent management?'

name: Josh Baron
title: Faculty
bio: Josh Baron is a Senior Lecturer at Harvard Business School and co-founder of BanyanGlobal, a family business advisory firm. He co-authored the Harvard Business Review Family Business Handbook and teaches courses on ownership and leading family businesses.

name: Elisabeth Paulson
title: Faculty
bio: Elisabeth Paulson is an Assistant Professor in the Technology and Operations Management Unit at Harvard Business School. Her research focuses on operations for social good, designing analytical methods and algorithms for allocating scarce resources efficiently and fairly in areas like immigration and food policy.

name: William Marks
title: Faculty
bio: William Marks is an Executive Fellow at Harvard Business School in the Technology and Operations Management Unit. He has co-authored cases on Moderna and Gates Ventures, collaborating with faculty on research and teaching activities.

name: Antonio Moreno
title: Faculty
bio: Antonio Moreno is the Sicupira Family Associate Professor at Harvard Business School. His research studies the digital transformation of operations, particularly in retail and service industries, and he received the Wickham Skinner Early-Career Research Accomplishments Award.

name: Jacqueline N. Lane
title: Faculty
bio: Jacqueline Lane is an Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School and co-Principal Investigator of the Laboratory for Innovation Science at Harvard. Her research explores how expertise influences project evaluation and how AI can complement human expertise in decision-making, partnering with organizations like NASA.

name: Miaomiao Zhang
title: Faculty
bio: Miaomiao Zhang is a doctoral candidate in the Technology and Operations Management Unit at Harvard Business School. Her research focuses on human-AI collaboration in the early stages of innovation, studying how AI technologies interact with human creativity and decision-making.

name: Ryan W. Buell
title: Faculty
bio: Ryan Buell is the C.D. Spangler Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. His research investigates how operational transparency and service design affect customer behavior and firm performance, and he has received multiple awards for teaching excellence.

name: Marco Iansiti
title: Faculty
bio: Marco Iansiti is the David Sarnoff Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School and co-director of the Laboratory for Information Science at Harvard. His research examines digital transformation and AI's impact on strategy, and he co-authored the bestselling 'Competing in the Age of AI.'

name: Elisabeth C. Paulson
title: Faculty
bio: Elisabeth Paulson is an Assistant Professor in the Technology and Operations Management Unit at Harvard Business School. Her research focuses on operations for social good, designing analytical methods and algorithms for allocating scarce resources efficiently and fairly in areas like immigration and food policy.

name: Hise O. Gibson
title: Faculty
bio: Hise Gibson is a Senior Lecturer at Harvard Business School and a retired U.S. Army Colonel with 25 years of distinguished military service. He received the Bronze Star medal for his leadership in Iraq and Afghanistan, and his research focuses on inclusive leadership, operational effectiveness, and crisis management.

name: Amy C. Edmondson
title: Faculty
bio: Amy Edmondson is the Novartis Professor of Leadership and Management at Harvard Business School. She coined the term 'team psychological safety' and is ranked #1 on Thinkers50's global ranking of management thinkers. Her book 'The Fearless Organization' has become a foundational text on workplace culture.

name: Shane Greenstein
title: Faculty
bio: Shane Greenstein is the Martin Marshall Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School. A technology economist, his research encompasses computing, communication, and Internet markets, and his work has been featured in The New York Times and The Wall Street Journal.

name: Feng Zhu
title: Faculty
bio: Feng Zhu is the MBA Class of 1958 Professor of Business Administration at Harvard Business School, where he leads the Platform Lab. His research focuses on platform strategy, digital transformation, and business model innovation, and he has advised firms including Alphabet, Meta, Microsoft, and Uber.
